cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 245 miles south of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift west‐northwest, then slowly turn northwest toward the central Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Port Aransas TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande and east of Intracoastal City LA to Morgan City LA (tropical-storm watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Intracoastal City LA (tropical-storm warning); Port Aransas TX to High Island TX (hurricane watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast, southwest and south-central Louisiana coast, and minor surge impacts as far east as Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions possible Monday–Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft surge possible along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula, beginning late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–3 inches of rain; localized minor flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip currents may disrupt port approaches and small-craft operations
